data.title: Breeze-Thru
data.subtitle: Design / Development
data.description:
Breeze-Thru is an application that allows new customers to activate their service on any phone.

As the leader of the front-end team, I worked on this application from the beginning to the production. My role was to code, design, and help manage the team. There was a strong focus on UX and accessibility. With great communication with the network, back-end, and business team, we were able to launch the application. After the app launching, it became a success and I was rewarded with "The AT&T Service Excellence Award" soon after.

images.alt: Breeze-Thru add IMEI and ICCID data

data.title: aio to Cricket Wireless
data.subtitle: Development
data.description: When rebranding the website from aio to Cricket we had to change sections of the site per release. Because of this, we had to figure out certain issues like ensuring new pages and older pages wouldn't conflict with each other. It took about a year to completely re-brand the site.

data.title: Company Development
data.subtitle: Design / Development
data.description: Around 2013, I joined a team to create a SaaS application for land surveying, engineering, and geospatial services firms. I was tasked to design all the elements for the application then work on any development.

images.alt: Rove Logix Client App Permission Settings

data.title: New App Skin
data.subtitle: Design
data.description: At some point during the Rove Logix development, I started to update the design for a cleaner modern look. I paid better attention to color contrast and a better choice of colors. If you check out the Company Development page, the email design matches this design. Unfortunately, we never had a chance to use this new design in the client app.

images.alt: Rove Logix Client Center with Quick Search
Rove Logix Record Expense with tooltip

data.title: Caterpillar Inc. News App
data.subtitle: Design / Development
data.description: I created the UI and some minor development work for this iPhone and Android App. This app was packed with a CAT stock price, latest news from CAT, videos, pdfs and more.

data.title: 2013 Clorox Annual Report
data.subtitle: Development
data.description: Being responsive was the main feature for this site. Using the Zurb Foundation Framework I created a mobile-first application. Having creative freedom on the mobile layouts I made sure the navigation and content were easy to use and read.

images.alt: 2013 Clorox Annual Report About Report page
2013 Clorox Annual Report tablet and mobile versions

data.title: 2012 Darden Annual Report
data.subtitle: Design / Development
data.description: With the designers swamped with work, I was given the task to design the 2012 Darden annual report website. While I mostly did the design I did some development work.

images.alt: 2012 Darden Annual Report Built to Deliver
2012 Darden Annual Report Built to Deliver 2

data.title: CSP Generator App
data.subtitle: Design / Development
data.description:
A weather app that allows the user to add or remove numerous weather widgets on the dashboard.

To improve my skills with a modern web framework, I decided to create a simple weather app. Having knowledge of React Native, I created this app in React to compare the frameworks. This app uses the openWeatherMap API and stores the weather information in the browser for later use.

See the app in action

GitHub Repository

data.title: Crunchy Roll Website Concept
data.subtitle: Design
data.description: A redesign concept I did for the Crunchy Roll website. The purpose was to update the design to a cleaner look and not feel dated.

data.title: CosMikata
data.subtitle: Design / Development
data.description:
An app that will allow cosplayers and cosmakers more freedom to organize their work.

I created this application as a personal need to organize future cosplays with a mix of Trello and Cosplanner features. Being a solo project, I’m building the app from conception to production. With no target date to launch, I’m taking my time to test a bunch of technologies. I ended up using GraphQL, PostgreSQL, and Graphile after trying REST, MongoDB and a bunch of ORMs.

videos.description: First video talks about the application in detail.
videos.title: CosMikata Video 1

videos.description: This video continues to talk about other parts of the application. Note: Around 2:30 I said "iOS 5" but I meant iPhone 5.
